text.p: The stock of Clarify Inc. fell nearly 25 percent Wednesday after the help-desk software maker reported disappointing results.

The company, which writes computer programmes to help customer service departments keep track of their telephone calls, reported Tuesday that its fourth-quarter earnings jumped almost five-fold to $2.89 million, or 13 cents a share, from $614,000, or 3 cents a share, a year ago. Fourth-quarter revenues more than doubled to $19.2 million from $8.2 million.
But Wall Street was unhappy with the company's announcement that its accounts receivables -- the amount of money owed by customers -- doubled to $18 million in the fourth quarter.
Some investors view rising receivables as an indicator of a slowdown in future business.
